In theory, you expect something more in Apple's flagship tablet, something a bit more powerful, with perhaps more graphical horsepower.In practice, you won't notice a thing. Web browsing and apps still handle as snappily as ever, even if you have a gaggle of things running in the background. Top-tier games such as Infinity Blade 3 continue to deliver. A pleasant surprise is also how quickly some of the beefier games, such as Anomaly 2, loaded, compared to previous iPads. You'll move into and out of levels just a little bit more swiftly, and that helps make the entire gaming experience more friendly and natural. It's hard to know what this really means for Apple gaming, but don't rule out the possibility of more console titles being ported to the iPad.Apple realizes the limitations of the 64 GB storage too, offering a new 128-gig model. You'll pay a more-than-average-laptop premium here ($799 for the WiFi-only model and $929 for an LTE version), but the improved storage is intriguing, especially for those planning for a game-heavy future. I can now easily and comfortably load all the music and movies onto the iPad Air that I want and still have plenty of room left over for games such as XCOM: Enemy Unknown and Civilization: Revolutions.Battery life is steady, even if it's not mind-blowing. Apple claims the iPad Air can get you 10 hours on a charge, and that's definitely true. Even when using Apple's navigation for a long trip to Washington, I easily got through a day without needing to charge; and more casual usage, such as Web browsing and email checks, is no problem.The Air's lone shortcoming is that it lacks the fingerprint identification technology that debuted on the iPhone 5S. But I'd be hard-pressed to claim that this was some glaring omission; every other tablet you're going to use this year lacks such tech, and I've never seen that tech as an absolute must-have.The resulting tablet is as pleasant to use as they come, and it's backed by some consistently solid software. Android has made a tremendous run over the past few years, and a plethora of both Android and Windows Mobile devices are truly intriguing this holiday season. But if there's one consistent shortcoming on those devices, it's the up-and-down support of operating systems.It's hard to know whether this Android tab or that will support Google's latest OS, but that's almost never a problem with iPads. iOS releases are generally consistent and stable, the lone knock on Apple being its lack of Android-like customization.And while the Apps Store and iTunes are also battling competition from Microsoft's stores and Google's Marketplace, Apple's setup continues to set the bar, managing to be intuitive and easy to use and enjoying more and more high-profile digital releases.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Amy Leftis
Reviews.Content: Much faster than the original ipad. A little smaller and lighter in weight. Easy to use and carry with you.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice!!
Reviews.Author: Cyndi
Reviews.Content: I struggle with new technology so I'm still learning about my new iPad Air, but I really like it so far.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Victoria Enger
Reviews.Content: Best iPad ever.  Love it.Beautiful pictures and great functions. Wouldn't have another and other kind of tablet.  Light and easy to take around

Reviews.Title: I love it !
Reviews.Author: Julie Ramson
Reviews.Content: I got this two weeks ago and love it!  It's all that I hoped it would be and more.  The product came in perfect condition, sooner than I had expected and the seller followed up to be sure I was satisfied.  I would definitely buy from them again.  They were great!

Reviews.Title: The most well rounded tablet you can buy
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: After previously using the iPad 2 , this iPad is a whole new world. Apple constantly thrives to improve there products, and this one is no exception. The new IOS coupled with the blazing fast 64-bit a7 chip makes this one of the fastest tablets I have used! The ease and simplicity of this tablet makes everyday emails, messaging, projects,etc. no problem. This is the only tablet I have looked forward to using.Now for more serious activities like gaming and other intensive applications, the iPad has no problems what so ever. The graphics are very smooth, almost life-like.  From the outside, this is the most beautiful tablet hands down. From the chamfered edges to the sleek aluminum back, this is a high quality device. Most other tablets are made out of cheap plastics, not this one. Everything feels well made and solid. Even though apple chose to use metals and other high end materials, the iPad remains one of the lightest and thinnest full size tablets you can buy. Another high point for the iPad air its the battery. It seems to go on forever! After using it throughout the day, I end up with 70 to 80 percent battery! Its unbelievably how much juice this thing holds! Some miscellaneous things about the iPad that push it even further over the top are the decent cameras and the excellent microphones and speakers. The speakers have a good base tone and very clear high pitches. Overall I would recommend this tablet to anyone looking for a device that can do pretty much anything. I just don't see anyway the apple can improve on this iPad. I guess we will just have to wait and see.  Keep it up Apple.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: rafagrullon
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly light. Brilliant tablet. Brilliant quality. Apple had this right. Can't say anything negative about it. Would recomend without hesitating. PS.: It comes with a wall charger and USB lighting cable.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: babajou99
Reviews.Content: Has all the features I am looking for IPAD with the new technology and features to work and to have.

Reviews.Title: It's Grrrreeaaat!
Reviews.Author: Billie too
Reviews.Content: The color and picture are even better than my HD TV. Got this for my Husband for Christmas. He's hardly put it down since then. We have a Roku 2 but the picture quality on the iPad Air is far superior to the TV and he now prefers to watch movies on the tablet instead of the television. Luckily I can still use my iPad Mini when I want to watch on the bigger screen.

Reviews.Title: iPad
Reviews.Author: William Myers
Reviews.Content: First iPad that I owned and just love it. For the price is should include a pen. Otherwise I have no other negative feedback.

Reviews.Title: Ultra fast processor performance.
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Pong
Reviews.Content: 60 fps performance on GT Racing 2.  The A7 processor is a beast.  I upgraded from the iPad 3 and the performance upgrade is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad Air
Reviews.Author: Larretta G. Hay
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful gift to me from me!  I have been wanting and iPad for awhile and when the iPad air was introduced, I knew I had to have it!

Reviews.Title: The best purshase that I did
Reviews.Author: Jasmina G.Boycheva
Reviews.Content: I never had apple before an I decided to have one,I am very satisfying of this purshase.I forgotten my laptops my android phones....very positiveP

Reviews.Title: Best iPad so far!
Reviews.Author: R. Lee "Gadget lover"
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth iPad and it is by far the iPad out there.  I love the light weight, faster connection, quicker processing time, and less charging time (with the 12W charger).  I use it every day and I love it.If you are in the market for an iPad, check it out.  Apple's support, generous return policy, durability, ease of use, consistency in OS, abundant apps, and high quality are the strong points.  My first iPad from 3 years ago is still working flawlessly today and yes, it is also being used daily by my family members.

Reviews.Title: The Item was not as described. It was a used item re-packed.
Reviews.Author: Yong Yang
Reviews.Content: Received an used item, all accessories were loosely re-packed,  and not sure if everything is there. The box has two 2-4 inch cuts.

Reviews.Title: Love the product but wont recharge!
Reviews.Author: mavpcc
Reviews.Content: I bought this product and really love it! Only one thing wrong, the USB cable does not work and I have been unable to recharge the unit. Fortunate for me, my wife has an I-Phone 5 and the cords are compatible. I travel a lot, so I really need my own charger but more importantly, I need the one that I paid for to work properly....

Reviews.Title: My first iPad, I love it!
Reviews.Author: jean
Reviews.Content: I got the iPad because my daughters had one and I am now hooked! It is so convenient to take on trips and can do almost everything I can do on my laptop while out of town. The slim size is great too for keeping weight down in my carry on. Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: FAST LIGHT N CONVENIENT
Reviews.Author: Guo Ming Wang
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. I got the space gray 32gb one. It's light,fast,and convenient. However it looks like t's easy to break but besides that this is an awesome machine

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Ipad
Reviews.Author: Dawn Clark
Reviews.Content: I recommend this Ipad to all who were just like me.  I had the very first Ipad.  Oh my gosh, what a difference!  As I lay them side to side I cannot believe I held onto my old one for so long!  The new features and pictures and sound are more enriched for eyes and ears to enjoy!  It is so light and thin!  I have not been more happy with any item in past two years as I am with this Ipad!  It is more than worth the price!  It only needs a USB port and it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: GREAT GIFT...LIVED UP TO ALL EXPECTATIONS...
Reviews.Author: Margie
Reviews.Content: The individual I presented this to as a gift told me this Apple iPad Air MD786LL/A is AWESOME!  It does everything Apple claims it to do and does it extremely well.  The floor is beautiful and sharp, the apps are great and the entire package is packed with useable and the best you can get for your money.Yes, I would definitely recommend this product.  It is a Class A Act!

Reviews.Title: Cheaper than an Apple store
Reviews.Author: rlasrado
Reviews.Content: Cheaper to procure from Amazon than an Apple store. Perfect.Tons of reviews on the ipad [my second air]- number of apple products in the household so a no brainer. Yes it has it's issues - cannot multitask, no usb etc but those are sacrifices for the overall experience

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: Katerina Nares
Reviews.Content: This iPad is incredible slim, user friendly, useful, fast.  I cannot believe my finger could control everything on it.  What an invention!  Bravo Mac

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from an iPad 2 -- very happy!
Reviews.Author: Thikacat
Reviews.Content: Amazingly versatile and much lighter than the older models.  I use it several times a day and it is a read time saver.

Reviews.Title: Just as I expected, Fantastic.
Reviews.Author: WillieArthur
Reviews.Content: The iPad arrived on schedule, which is always a big plus for me when buying Online. I love the quality of the iPad Air, its brilliant, but I would like to see some features similar to Samsung devices, such as widgets, dual screen, etc. That said the quality of the iPad is just brilliant. .

Reviews.Title: Wicked-FAST and super slick!
Reviews.Author: conis
Reviews.Content: (Update below)Upgraded from an iPad 1 (aka an iPadosaur) If you are used to an older iPad, do your homework. Navigation is way different.BTW. If you are running on battery only and don't need location services, shut it off. Its a huge battery sucker.BTW#2: I almost bought a longer charge cable for this (newer lightning connect style) since the one that comes with it 4' is too short for the real world. Instead I spent $3.00 for a 6' USB extension cord to extend between the charge module and lightning cord. It works fine and will keep the battery at 100%  while I am working. IF location service is not activated.One gripe about the AIR seems to be reduced battery life. Shut off the services and features you don't need on all the time.(UPDATE 5/5/14)Been using the #5 air for over a month now... I LOVE IT! Theres a little learning curve moving up from iOS 5 to 7+, not an issue. I had no problem moving my "stuff" including apps, to the new iPad.... The finti cover, is sweet, too! Recommended!Next on line is an iPad mini (soon) and I'll elaborate a bit....I use a verizon mifi modem with my pads when I travel. (converts cell-wireless to wifi) Internet/email anywhere. Works great. In doing this, I have scrapped my cell phone and installed skype phone on my iPads... Flawless voip service, full feature with dedicated phone #... All for $6.00 a month a $.o2 a minute pay as I go. Compare that to the cost of a smartphone with data package! So saying, a mini will fit in my pocket as a large smartphone and serve all my needs on the road... IN MY POCKET...iPads are truly "swiss army knife" devices if you get the apps and set them up right. Most don't understand all the things an iPad can do.

Reviews.Title: Hat loves air.
Reviews.Author: Hat
Reviews.Content: GreatVery good product.I bought it for my wife and she is enjoying it very much. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Heneghan
Reviews.Content: Everything so far is just peachy keen new at this high tech stuff would recommend product LEARNING MORE EVERY DAY

Reviews.Title: OMG LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Danielle Parks
Reviews.Content: This thing is unreal! so slick and sparkly!!! lol I love my new ipad air! it even has siri!! so rad!! ships fast too!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Rodney Castro
Reviews.Content: I have never owned an ipad before but I really did my research to make sure if I really wanted the latest opacity or would I do with a cheaper older ipad.  The truth is this device is amazing!  When multitasking between games and browser and music this thing flies and I don't even notice any lags! Also the screen is so clear and high def thanks to its retina screen I believe? The ipad air responds to my every touch and swipe with ease and I'm only beginning to learn its many uses!  As a first time buyer who is price conscious,  I will say. This was the best purchase decision I made because for the price I spent,  I got a high performance ipad that beats all others with ease and with all its new features and compatibility with new and upcoming tech, I'm somewhat ready for it too! Other than all that. The ipad air is worth its price even if you are worried about price I say save the extra hundred dollars for this guy

Reviews.Title: It's nice
Reviews.Author: De cheng
Reviews.Content: I buy it for my friend, and she said it was very beautiful and love it so much, but it a little expensive

Reviews.Title: Convenient
Reviews.Author: Rachel Griffin
Reviews.Content: I like my Apple iPad Air.  This is my first iPad.  I enjoy the light weight convenience of being able to have it handy when I want to see or show how to craft video to my Mom and friends in other areas of my house.

Reviews.Title: IPad Air !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Alex Godino
Reviews.Content: Best tablet on the market right now ! And Great battery life ! Since Started using this ipad I don't use my computer anymore . So impressed !

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Kiki
Reviews.Content: Admittedly this is my first tablet, but so far it works great. I couldn't even tell it had been previously used.

Reviews.Title: Great iPad.. Step up from other older versions
Reviews.Author: bigbeezy209
Reviews.Content: Love this iPad air.. It's so light & sleek that it's not a burden to carry around everywhere you want to go... Screen looks beautiful and build quality is just like every apple product.. A+

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: arthur
Reviews.Content: i like it and hope word could be used when I open the apple ipad air.in fact ,I can not find the difference between ipad 4 and ipad air

Reviews.Title: had to buy charger
Reviews.Author: robert bennett
Reviews.Content: Ipad is great! Charger was not. Would've given 5 stars but charger had short in it had to buy new charger.

Reviews.Title: ipad mypad!
Reviews.Author: Rita Runyon
Reviews.Content: I love it… I just haven't figured out how to use it… I can't get to the Apple store at the mall, for help, they do not have electric carts and I can't get inside without assistance. I have been using it to do some reading online and it's great! I sold a cherished antique to buy this and I'm so glad I did! I'll get this figured out.

Reviews.Title: First tablet...it is awesome
Reviews.Author: Sonya B Dean "webrose"
Reviews.Content: this is my first tablet so take that info into consideration...I have an iphone 4 so was able to sync all my apps and contacts and everything else including music very easily.

Reviews.Title: Tablet decision
Reviews.Author: Kathy Bridges
Reviews.Content: I debated which tablet to get for over a year, sitting on the fence, afraid to make a move. Finally, I decided that since I had an I-phone, this was probably the easiest move for me. I am so pleased, was up and going in about 5 minutes. Donating my nook to the 2 year old granddaughter today.

Reviews.Title: The  best on the market
Reviews.Author: Kathleen D.
Reviews.Content: I really like my I pad it takes beautiful pictures. Plus we took it to the ice rink where my 5 and 7 year old granddaughters takeskating lessons. we took video's of them and they loved watching them. over and over.

Reviews.Title: IPAD AIR
Reviews.Author: Bishnu D Piya
Reviews.Content: awesome device much lighter and smaller thann the regular ipad's.Easy to handle. Much faster in processing than the old ipad's

Reviews.Title: I-pad air 32 GB
Reviews.Author: J. morford
Reviews.Content: I love my new I-pad air!!!  Faster, lighter and perfect in every way!!!  love it!I would highly recommend. It!!

Reviews.Title: in love
Reviews.Author: Justin & Sarah P. "Creature... For a while."
Reviews.Content: of course I am in love!  Came a day earlier than expected...it was like Christmas morning for me!  iPad is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: Crazy thin and light plus beautiful screen
Reviews.Author: sgun73 "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I've had every generation of ipad and both minis and several androids and this tablet right here and now is the best ever made and my clear favorite. The thinness and lightness almost doesn't make sense. I did find myself confused at first as to how such an amazing device could be made by humans. Maybe it wasn't. Could have come from space. Or maybe the Enterprise from the future brought it back to Apple and said here. Enjoy.But seriously, the build quality is wonderful. As light and thin as this tablet is it still feels solid and sturdy. The screen is beautiful and the colors are deep and rich. The colors are actually noticeably better than the first and second generation minis. I've held them side by side and there is a pretty wide gap between the two in terms of richness of color. The ipad air looks vibrant and robust with deep blacks and warm bold colors.Plus it's very fast. I loaded up GT Racing 2 last night and it ran flawlessly fast and looked absolutely gorgeous. I couldn't believe how sharp the cars looked and the backgrounds had such depth. I should stop writing and go play right now.Despite the other great tablets like the Nexus 7 and 10 or the Samsung Galaxies 8 and 10 the ipad air is in another realm. A realm all to itself. You'll never pick up another tablet and be shocked at the miracle of design you hold in your hands.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Ben A. Holliday "Ben"
Reviews.Content: It was a gift to my wife and she loves it, so that makes it worth it. As much as she uses the iphone now she at it with the ipad. Shewatches TV and a movie on the iPad at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Loved It!
Reviews.Author: Ramon S. Reyes
Reviews.Content: This iPad Air was a gift for my wife and she continues to enjoy it immensely.  The unit is much lighter than her first generation iPad and the graphics are definitely better.  She can now use Facetime since this new unit has a camera, one that did not come with her original iPad.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Ana Sofia De Agrela
Reviews.Content: The iPad air is the best iPad yet! If you buy it you won't regret it! Really love my new iPad :)

Reviews.Title: Ipad Air
Reviews.Author: Karen A. Stoner
Reviews.Content: So far can find NOTHING wrong (CON) about my new ipad Air!!! (PROS- It is smaller & definitely lighter and has some new features!I had previously purchased the Ipad 2nd Generation and was VERY "happy" with it! BUT in my very rushed world, I dropped and cracked the front screen...:-( Not knowing what to do, BUT knew I didn't want to be WITHOUT my ipad. (I take it almost everywhere I go.) So when someone asked what I wanted for Christmas, I told them! So now I have my travel ipad and my stay-at-home (Ipad Air).So now, I won't be without my Ipad...:-) I will update my review if the need arises.

Reviews.Title: Hubby Loves IPAD!
Reviews.Author: Pinkbubblegum4me
Reviews.Content: Hubby, who is somewhat tech challenged, loves this! So easy to use and READ! Now I can use the desktop computer again!

Reviews.Title: Smaller in a good way
Reviews.Author: Aaron Smith
Reviews.Content: I have really big hands and I can palm this thing.  I truly like the smaller bezel around the edge.  That has always been wasted space in my mind.  I came off an iPad 2 and this one is significantly faster.  Text is significantly clearer on the retina type display.  A great design and works like a charm.

Reviews.Title: Buy one
Reviews.Author: bonniejean815
Reviews.Content: Awesome iPad. Best ever yet. Fast. Beautiful display light and thin  Best ever  worth every penny. Battery lasts longer. Than earlier models

Reviews.Title: Didn't think I needed one....till it was in my hand.
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Headline says it all. So ridiculously light and sleek. If you're trying to save a few pennies, maybe look at the Nexus 7 or Kindle HDX, but if you want the best, this is it.

Reviews.Title: GET ONE, IF YOU HAVEN'T ALREADY
Reviews.Author: Mr. T. Echeumuna
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with my iPad Air. It is unbelievably light for an item this size. You will not believe it. If you have had ones of the earlier iterations, then you will know what I am on about. But if not and you are looking for a tablet - money no object - then get this iPad, and  you won't regret it.Enough said!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: DRM
Reviews.Content: Great tablet and I have been slow to get on the Apple wagon.  Many apps even in my narrow field make this a better tablet for now than the alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Great product! Fast light and powerful
Reviews.Author: wunat
Reviews.Content: Great product! Fast delivery. I use it pretty much for everything. Very good tablet. Fast light and powerful. Battery life is great.

Reviews.Title: Home run !
Reviews.Author: m y carr
Reviews.Content: The light weight is great.The wide screen I love.The clear and sharp viewing is beautiful .The fast speed you just can't beat.

Reviews.Title: Great device.
Reviews.Author: SHEY
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new iPad. It's amazing! It was a present for me and I can't get enough of it. My entire family loves it. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: A great gift
Reviews.Author: Georgeen Carden
Reviews.Content: Gave it to my husband for Christmas and he loved it. The only complaint is the start-up process was difficult to understand and required tech assistance (available Christmas Day!!!). Apple continues to do it right in electronics.

Reviews.Title: best gift
Reviews.Author: diane trekell
Reviews.Content: fast shipping, well packed, best Christmas Gift ever. looking forward to using it for work fun and playing games, pictures

Reviews.Title: Not all that
Reviews.Author: aldridge
Reviews.Content: Everything is a la carte, so it becomes a drag to go to the Apple store and then discover it does not have as many apps as Android.You have to compartmentalize different programs and that slows down the interaction between the user and the technology. It is more secure, but it has a longer learning curve. Without Flash it limits where to go. Had 2, sold one and may want to sell the other Air to buy something more accessible. when it is side by side with other non-Apple tablets, it is an expensive16 gig, non-upgrading, email item.

Reviews.Title: Great devices to have.
Reviews.Author: Janice Hemsley
Reviews.Content: The Apple IPad Air is a great device.  It feels comfortable to hold in your hands.  The only dislike I have is that it don't support Adobe Flash Player.  I like to play certain games on my computer, but when I pulled them up the the Apple Air, I'm not able to download.  After reading more about why Apple doesn't support Adobe on none of their devices, I was kind of upset.  I wish I would had looked more into this before I purchase this ipad.  I've only had it for a week and now I'm trying to sell it.

Reviews.Title: iPad air......
Reviews.Author: Alistair
Reviews.Content: I recently switched from the kindle fire HD to the iPad air. I like the larger screen, stunning resolution and general,ease of use. Ok so it is more expensive but I believe you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: For those who are still thinking about upgrading from the iPad 3
Reviews.Author: Dmitry Shishkin
Reviews.Content: To make it short: no, it is not worth upgrading from iPad 3 based on my experience...After reading all these excited reviews I finally gave in to the temptation to get one from the store, thinking that may be if I play with it more I would see how awesome it is (trying it in the store did not impress me that much). After a few days of using the iPad Air and iPad 3 I can tell that an upgrade would not be worth the hassle of putting my older iPad on ebay and making up the difference which would be around $300 I guess (I have the 16 GB version) . Actually, a lot of professional reviewers online recommend exactly this: don't upgrade if you already have either an iPad 3 or iPad 4.The difference in size and weight is (slightly) noticeable when you are picking the device or holding it in your hands. The thing is that I never just hold my iPad in my hands when using it (and I do use it a lot!). Most of its weight goes either to the desk when I am at my desk, or to my lap if I am in my chair, or to my chest if I am on my couch. Which means I am basically using my hand(s) to balance the iPad not to support it. In such situations extra 7 ounces is not a big deal at all.If you are using your iPad differently (for example, playing games a lot) then you might appreciate the iPad Air better. Also, if you just want to have the latest and the coolest iPad then of course that would be worth it too :)Seems like Apple is following the same pattern with both the iPad 2 and the iPad Air, mostly squeezing the same device in a smaller package. This is not good enough for me. I waited until the iPad 3 came out to upgrade my iPad 1 (yes, Retina display was totally worth it!) and I hope that the iPad 6 will be worth an upgrade. But I am not getting into the hassle of replacing my iPad just to get a little bit thinner/narrower and lighter.Making the decision to return the iPad Air got even easier when I realized that its screen has a noticeable yellow tint which makes my iPad 3 look a bit bluish which I like better.Good bye, iPad Air, and lets hope that Apple will be able to impress even the most conservative of us with the iPad 6 in October 2014! (Speaking of being conservative, I am still using IOS 6 on my iPad - it is better to be safe than sorry! :)

Reviews.Title: IPad Air
Reviews.Author: Harold D. Smith
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a gift and seems to be well received.  My only problem with this purchase, I seem to have paid about $150. more than everyone else I know that also received the same unit,  Obviously I'm not happy about that.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect besides the lack of RAM and some iOS 7 bugs
Reviews.Author: AK529
Reviews.Content: The ipad air is what the ipad 4 should have been. It is lighter, thinner, narrower, faster and has stereo speakers. Its almost half a pound lighter which really makes a difference when holding the ipad in your hands for long periods of time. I no longer need to use my ipad stand. Typing and holding it in portrait mode are much easier. People with larger hands will be able to hold the ipad with one hand very easily. Performance is also much improved with new A7 processor. Apps open, close and switch faster than on the ipad 4. Wifi is now double the speed with the double mimo antenna. For those who have supporting routers loading web pages, downloading apps, books, videos, music is much faster. The new stereo speakers are much loader and have more bass than on the previous ipad. The stereo affect will only be noticed when holding the iPad in portrait mode. This is a shame since you wont enjoy the stereo affect when watching a video or playing a game in landscape mode. Also the speakers are very easy to muffle if you cover one or both of them on the right side in landscape mode. The main flaw of the ipad air is its lack of 2GB of ram. When browsing and having more than a few tabs open this is very noticeable. The tabs have to reload when switching back and forth. This also becomes an issue when switching between apps that are open. Both the ipad 3 and 4 had 2GB of RAM. The only reason I can think of why apple decided not the upgrade the RAM is to make customers upgrade to the next ipad. The other downside to the ipad air is the fact that its running ios 7. ios 7 for the most part is in improvement over ios 6. It is faster and has more features, but, it also has many bugs that still need to be fixed. Even with 7.04 installed I still experience rotation issues. The ipad doesnt auto rotate when switching between portarit and landscape mode. This issue occurs atleast once a day. Mainly when the multitasking gestures is enabled and auto rotation. There are many threads on apple discussions forums about this issue. I thought at first my ipad was deffective even made an appointment to see a genius. I was told there was no way to test the hardware but was offered a warranty replacment. I decided instead to exchange the ipad and the replacement also had the same issue. I have to add also my ipad 4 had the same issue also when I updated it to ios 7. I hope apple fixes this issue in 7.1. This is very annoying and not something I expected from apple. The ipad air also doesnot have the ability to run 2 or more apps at one time which both the new samsung note 10.1 2014 and Microsoft surface tablet can do. I did try the samsung tablet briefly and found the screen and speakers much better than the ipad air's. The ipad still is the best larger tablet on the market because it has a huge selection of tablet apps and it gets the apps first before any other platform. I also love the battery life on my ipad air. I was getting about 15 hours of usage on my ipad 4 with the brightness at 35% and about 5 notifications with browsing and email. Now with the ipad air I am gettting more than 15 hours. Anywhere from 16-18 hours of battery life depending on my usage. The new ipad air is must have for gamers, power users and people who take the ipad on the go. If you can wait the next ipad will defeintly have 2GB of RAM and wont have as many bugs. There is also a good chance a new ipad will be released in the next 1-2 years which will be larger in screen size and more powerful named the ipad pro.Update after owning for more than 4 months: Apple just released the 7.1 update. My iPad Air is finally stable, this is what ios 7 should have been from the start. There are no more crashes, reboots and the auto rotation issue is fixed. I am still giving this ipad 4 stars since it took apple more than 4 months to fix these issues. Also the ipad lacks 2gb of ram, there are no widgets, thrid party keyboards, expandable storage or way to run 2 apps at once side by side. The iPad Air is till the best 10 inch tablet on the market. It beats any android or microsoft tabelt currently on the market in the 10 inch category. Also it has the most tablet apps.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Diane Allen
Reviews.Content: What an amazing ipad! The ipad air is wonderful! Light, fast, all the computer you need! Apple products are hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: IPad is GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: Janelle Nordine
Reviews.Content: I simply cannot believe all the things I can do on the IPad!  I've even created spreadsheets!  I am a true fan of Apple products.  My four granddaughters (the oldest is seven) play it every time they come.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Luciano
Reviews.Content: Amazing, it's my first i-x and I really like it. Strongly recomended for people that need just a tablet at home...

Reviews.Title: I’m glad I did otherwise I wouldn’t have bought this tablet
Reviews.Author: Bastijn McFerrell
Reviews.Content: I owned a second generation iPad before needing to sell it for personal reasons. In hindsight, I’m glad I did otherwise I wouldn’t have bought this tablet.Before deciding on the iPad Air I considered the Kindle Fire and Nexus 7. The Microsoft Surface wasn’t an option since I really don’t like the operating system or customer service and I wanted my tablet to last longer than a year. Samsung wasn’t an option after the torture my Galaxy S3 put me through, which also ruled out Android, which then ruled out the Nexus 7. Some people are a fan of Android but I find it to be slow, unreliable and choppy. The aesthetic design isn’t my favorite either. But these are all a matter of personal opinion and experience. :)The Kindle Fire HDX looked great at first, but in the end I decided it wasn’t for me. I’m a writer and a student so being able to edit documents on the go is my main concern. I have an iMac so this unfortunately made using the Kindle for these purposes a little more difficult for me. While I can edit and share most documents on my iMac, including Microsoft Office, I primarily use Pages which isn’t available on the Kindle. I just don’t care for either Microsoft Word or Google Docs enough to use them all the time. Also, I never use the Amazon store to watch movies or shows or download music so that feature wasn’t appealing to me. I took a trip to Best Buy to try it out just in case that made me change my mind. This actually solidified my decision against it. While the Kindle Fire did feel surprisingly solid, I didn’t like the position of the buttons, smaller screen size (although the screen quality was pretty awesome) or the thick boarders around the screen. Again, all of these are a matter of preference.When I went to try out the iPad Air I was surprised by how much lighter it felt than the previous model iPad. I also liked the flat back and thinner edges on the side. It made using it easier for small handed people like me. The larger screen size made typing on the tablet much easier in those rare instances I might not have my keyboard. Keeping my documents in one place is amazingly simple and I like the applications I use for writing and classes. Also, iTunes U is just awesome!The only drawback for me is the price: I paid $300 more than I would have with the Kindle Fire HDX. I don’t think this is outrageously expensive, considering the larger screen, better hardware, operating system and customer service-- not to mention iTunes U-- but I do think the price could be lower.While there are other great tablets out there, I really enjoy my iPad Air. Electronics are all a matter of personal preference anymore anyway. If you don’t like a device, don’t buy it. It’s that simple. :)

Reviews.Title: Heavy Apple user, this not up to snuff
Reviews.Author: JustAGuy
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the ipad 1 to the ipad air mainly because of constant crashes with the ipad 1.The Air still crashes. From what I've read most people think it's a software issue, if that's the case then this is a 4 star product.What keeps it from a 5th star the the feel of the screen. The ipad 1 felt solid, like glass. This has a hollow plastic feel to it. Feels like if you type too hard it'll snap.I own almost every product Apple makes, this feels like I'm holding the decline of Apple in my hand.

Reviews.Title: Apple did a wonderful job on this.
Reviews.Author: S. Carter "carter the artist"
Reviews.Content: Granted I wanted the Space Gray and got stuck with a White, due to human error from the shipper. However, I think they did great on this iPad. I had an iPad 1 and it lasted for years (except for the fact that I couldn't update the iOS for the past year or so) and the difference in weight and speed is very noticeable.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Vertigo
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet with a fatally flawed web browser problem.  My iPad Air started with Safari crashing right out of the box.  I put up with it for a month and then had it replaced by Apple under warranty, however, the problem continued.  The experts at the Genius Bar said the problem would be fixed in iOS 7.1.  After upgrading to 7.1 today the issue persists.  Puffin browser seems more stable but still crashes on occasion.  Apple's failure to fix this is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Wish It Just Worked (Without Crashing So Much) And A Comparison With Other Devices
Reviews.Author: S. Jo
Reviews.Content: I'm not happy with this tablet but I got a good deal on it from one of the retail stores, $100 off, and it fits my needs best compared to what's currently being offered.The iPad Mini 2 is lighter but the screen is smaller and can't display as many colors, less gamut display. I've noticed this with my "old" Samsung Galaxy Tab 7 Plus, but this may not matter to some people.The Kindle HDX and Nexus 7 (2013) are, in that order, reported to have better screens- ppi and gamut display. However I'm not interested in buying too much into the Amazon App Store because I'm already in the plain Android ecosystem. The Samsung tablet line is not in consideration because I got burned by how the copy and paste function just stops working- a reset would fix it and soon after it would stop working. This issue first showed itself months after I got the device. I also wasn't interested in taking the time to jailbreak the Samsung tablet for that reason alone.I recently got a deal on the Nexus 7 (2013) and I'm getting it this week. I may keep it as a backup tablet and it's a plus that I'm already in the Android ecosystem. It has 2GB of RAM instead of Apple's current 1GB of RAM standard. It also comes with stock Android and the operating system can be easily upgraded without relying on mods. I'm hoping it will last 5 years but I've learned from the Amazon customer reviews that hardware quality control is an issue.Now back to the iPad Air. Aside from the screen I wanted the "Apple Experience" of "It just works." I like using a tablet for browsing and reading books. I also liked the idea of having access to apps that are exclusive to Apple. I've had the iPad Air for a little over a week and I'm really enjoying the bigger screen. I'm not sure I can really switch back to a smaller screen. I've downloaded a few apps, cooking related, that are exclusive to iOS and they're nice to have. Multitouch gesture is ok but the Android way of switching between apps and viewing running apps are more elegant.Why I took off three stars is because the iPad Air crashes a lot. It got to the point that I'd add a tab on Safari and it would crash even though I only had two other tabs open. I installed Chrome and the crashes happened less but they did not disappear. Search for iOS 7 crashes and low memory and you'll see this is a problem with a lot of iOS devices since the iOS 7 was introduced. I noticed other apps doing the same thing but maybe because I use them less I don't see them crashing as often.I had set up a phone appointment with Apple Support on Sunday and was told that upgrading to iOS 7.0.4 via WiFi might have caused the iOS to not fully update. I couldn't stay on the phone for too long so yesterday I did reset my tablet and set the iPad as New. I didn't buy their reasoning but I did like the Customer Support experience- setting up an appointment online etc.I really like the bigger screen and it's probably better for my eyes so I'm keeping the device. I'm also counting on Apple to fix the issue sooner rather than later- in various forums you'll read about people resetting their iOS device and doing multiple exchanges with no relief from the crashing. I will sign up for Apple Care+ which includes 2 Years of Tech Support and Accidental Damage so I can exchange the device if needed.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Galen V.
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, Apple produces highly polished products with a rich app ecosystem.  Many apps are optimized with animation and are even better on a larger screen, but....This device is not worth $500, its not worth $400, it probably should retail between $300 and 350, and here's why:*Locked in system. You have very little customization options. Yes, you can change wallpaper and move icons around the homescreen, but that's about it. No making the device an extension of your personality like Android.*Speakers. For being the most popular gadget on earth, why are there not stereo speakers on this device (one on each end of the tablet)? This is a serious design flaw that makes watching videos a huge drag because sound is muffled especially if the device is leaning on your lap.*Multitasking is a joke. These devices can only perform one task at a time. Apples competitors such as Samsung and Microsoft have already addressed this in their tablets, why hasn't Apple?*Screen Casting. This is not equipped with Miracast or have an HDMI out port. This means if you want to show your devices screen on a TV, you can't without buying a bunch of overpriced adaptors and cords.*Maps. Everybody knows that Apples map product is inaccurate and not worth installing.*No official keyboard, no official stylus, no ports, no casting, no multitasking, poor audio... why is this $500 again?

Reviews.Title: Sadly, disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought an Ipad Air (32GB/cellular) the same day they came out. Up until then, I had never owned an Apple product. I have always had Windows pc’s and I have an Android phone (Galaxy S4).I read that people just love the iPad’s and thought it would be time to try out an Apple product. I bought it from T-Mobile to get their free data promotion. Now that I’ve had one for about 3 months my overall opinion is “meh”. It’s ok.I don’t hate it. It’s light & portable. It’s great for watching movies and listening to music. However, there are limitations that make me wonder why the devices are so popular. For example, Swype doesn’t work on iPad’s and if you’ve ever used Swype on an Android device you know it’s a great feature but one I consider very basic. True multi-tasking doesn’t exist and you just don’t realize how much you’ll miss it until you don’t have it. You can’t print, for example, pages 1,3,&10 of a pdf. Instead, you can only choose a range, such as 1 thru 3. I still remember one of my first calls to Applecare+, where some young woman explained to me that you can’t do a search in a pdf. She actually suggested that I add hundreds of doctors that were in the pdf to my contact list so that I could then find individual doctors. I quickly ended that call. The Apple browser, Safari, is slow. Chrome, on the other hand, is fast. These are only small examples but in general, the iPad seems to be much less flexible than my Window’s computers or Android phone.As an aside, the support on Applecare+ varies widely. I have been connected to people that seem knowledgeable but have also had plenty of people that knew less about the iPad then I did, even after only 1 months use. Many of the young women referred to my iPad as an IPhone and didn’t have a clue how to help me.They are also expensive. I bought the 32GB version and thought it was a rip off to pay $100 for the extra 16GB.Now, my iPad Air is 3 months old and needs to be exchanged under warranty. After 10 minutes of use it can’t access the web anymore. Regardless of whether you use a browser or an app. They had me reset it back to the factory default but it didn’t fix the problem. It's stayed in a case and never left the house. It's been babied. I’ve never had any device fail after only 3 months use.I really wanted to love this device and thought I would based on other people’s feedback. It just hasn’t worked out for me though. It’s adequate, but not great, and hasn’t lived up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Don't plan on enjoying you headphones..if you enjoy music.
Reviews.Author: Gery
Reviews.Content: Air pad problems....I have 2 iPhones, iPad 3 gen, new air pad.  I have a big problem with the new air pad.  And I have been a big fan of apple products.  If your like me, in the evenings I sit and read and listen to music on my iPad. But,, If you want to listen using ear buds or any headphones, don't get this air pad.  You only hear sound thru the right ear only.  If you fiddle you can get it to work, for the moment, till you touch the plug it will go back to one ear.  I pd $79.00 to get apple care.  So I called, he sent me another Air Pad, it's doesn't work either.  So now, since I got two that don't work, I think they think I'm nuts.  I have apple ear buds, klipsch, Bowers Wilkins, ATH m50s headphones.  All of these work perfectly with my IPhone 4S.  I just can't figure it out, and I'm Very disappointed with the new Air Pad.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Girevik
Reviews.Content: I guess I was just expecting something a little faster, more competent. Up swipes are confused as side swipes, sometimes you'll have to tap the same spot five or six times to get a response, even if the icon is highlighting every time you push, the function doesn't happen. You can't place your cursor into the middle of a paragraph you just wrote if you want to edit, this mostly occurs in aps but come on, I have to delete everything to where I want to edit. Often, the iPad will randomly open Facebook or Twitter, because it thinks I touched the tiny icon on the corner of a web page or ap, when my finger was on something an inch away. Just writing this review, it corrected finger to ginger and when I tried to move the cursor to the word to edit, it randomly pasted a website URL from my clipboard where I had touched. I then deleted the unwanted erroneous URL, tried again, and it pasted the URL a second time... Delete. Try again. Maybe this thing is good for games and kids, but don't try to do mobile business on it unless you have the patience of a monk.PeterIt's the little things that kill, two stars.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the upgrade for me
Reviews.Author: Jose J. De Cruz "Joseph"
Reviews.Content: Three stars only because this iteration has a better volume and is slightly(almost unnoticeably)lighter. I think ipad 3 and 4 have a better quality built and their retina display is much brighter and colors are deeper than Ipad Air.

Reviews.Title: Super Thin & Perfect for Me!
Reviews.Author: J. Ferris "tunawish"
Reviews.Content: I made the switch from Windows to Mac about 2 years ago & loved the MacBook Pro while I only liked the older iPad mainly due to the fact it only had 16gb onboard & no memory card slot (it also slowed down noticeably with iOs 6.)I traded my MacBook Pro & old iPad for a new MacBook Air & a 64gb iPad Air & now I love my MacBook AND my iPad.Apple has now made iWorks (Pages, Numbers & Keynote) free with new devices & I've almost cut the Microsoft tether completely (hooray!)The iPad Air is lighter, faster & has a longer lasting battery & a bright, crisp display.All this in a sturdy yet stylish tablet (no cheap plastic here.)I don't know why anyone would want a Samsung or Microsoft tablet (unless they are forced to shop for a cheap alternative of course.)Call me a fanatic if you want but there is no substitute for the quality & ease of use of an Apple product...

Reviews.Title: Color me impressed
Reviews.Author: J.Page
Reviews.Content: I was going back and forth over which tablet to purchase for about 3.5 weeks.  I was a previous Iphone user that moved on to Android because I didnt like the size of the 5.  I have two kids so consumer level usability is high on my list especially with a son that has autism.My choice came down to a samsung or the ipad since the nexus 10 2 is still MIA. :)  The samsung had several things going for it.  MicroSD, customization and control, mutliple user profiles but to be honest their overlay is a huge turn off and the plether backing with fake stitching just looks horrid.  I would say that the plastics are fine but why bother with fake stitching? I spent time in a B&M; and the feel was good, but visually as a whole it felt less...high end even with the price being in the same range as the IPad.  With several cloud storage options and knowing that I would be using it for light work related items and sharing it with my kids to some extent the MicroSD while nice was not compelling.  I do wish apple would realize that multiple user accounts would be helpful because that is one of the things that almost moved me to the samsung.  Both screens of course are amazing and I have to give it to the samsung on using a better aspect ratio for media, but the samsung felt klugy when trying to use it in portrait.  So with all this being debated in my head for a few weeks back and forth I decided on the IPad.  As an aside, I love the build quality and would have seriously considers a Kindle Fire HDX but the lack of the google play store put it out of contention.  It is one thing to have a walled garden like apple where just about any app you can think of is available, but it is quite another to have a walled garden like Amazon where you either have to root or sideload to simply get some basic useful apps.  If the Kindle Fire HDX had google play store, this might have been an entirely different review. :)Two things have stood out as I have delved back into the walled garden that is Apple...One, It may be a walled garden, but it is a gorgeous garden.  The app quality and availability is outstanding. If they allowed Google Play Music I would not have any issues at all with the app store.  I think that the tighter development control that apple institutes on its apps is a double edged sword in some respects but I have not had anywhere near the amount of bugs that I find in the android store apps so in that respect I appreciate that 98.7% of the time when I download an app it just works.  I use it with several google services including chromecast and have been very happy with the results. On a side note, the hardware and build quality is meticulous and the IPad itself is even more impressive after prolonged use, but that has been discussed and beaten like the proverbial dead horse.Two, battery life.  Apple seems to know how to eek out the battery life with more finesse than some competitors.Overall I like the IPad Air much more than I thought I would.  I bought it knowing from a techie nerd stand point what I was giving up with the ecosystem and I have had no regrets at this point.  I can use it for work emails and presentations and come home to play netflix or games with the kids.  An outstanding product that I am sure I will use for the next year or two without issue.And my non-verbal autistic son can run this thing like a beast ;)

Reviews.Title: Absolutely stunning
Reviews.Author: grittynitty
Reviews.Content: Finally got a good chunk of cash when my tax return came and decided to get my own iPad (family had an iPad 2 but surely couldn't call it my own). I couldn't be happier. This thing is so well made and noticeably lighter and sturdier than the iPad 2. Very easy to set up as well.I recommend spending a little extra to get more memory. App sizes are just going to get bigger as time goes on. It just didn't make sense to me to pay so much for only 16 GB; I got the 64 GB myself and feel this iPad should serve me well for at least the next three years.

Reviews.Content: he iPad Air is a LOT lighter than the iPad 4, much faster (mostly play games on mine) and is solidly built. It's just expensive. All the games that had framerate issues on the 4 play smooth as silk now. Sound has improved as well. Also, the camera has improved. I took some really great photos of a storm that passed through, as well as some video.

Reviews.Title: Apple products are the best
Reviews.Author: Linda Childs
Reviews.Content: What I don't understand is, I'm working for the U.S. Navy in Yokosuka, Japan.  You sent this iPad to me at our P.O. Box here.  However, when I went back to Amazon and tried to order a case for it, I received a message that said you could not send computers overseas.  Really?  I just wanted to buy the case and you had already sent the iPad.  Kind of strange don't you think?

Reviews.Title: very good

Reviews.Author: Phil C, Boston
Reviews.Content: I've had an iPad v1 for the longest time and now that Apple doesn't support it and that the last version of most apps would crash mid-use, I decided I'd either have to get the latest or abandon the i-Line of products (something I thought about when I first learned about stopping iPad v1 support).Anyway, it's lighter, has a camera, etc.  And for the price and the number of years I had the iPad 1, it comes to ~$100/year before it isn't supported. Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the IPad  air. Works smoothly and is allI expected from the device. I have a 7" Nexus tablet, which was a good device as well, buy the extra size is great. I am doing this review on the IPad.  The battery life is superior on the iPad and a bit more available for apps although I had  no issue with the Android device. I briefly had the 16 GB version and exchanged for the 32 as I saw how quickly the 16 would fill up.

Reviews.Title: better than my computer

Reviews.Title: I love the new iPad. Air came in good condition

Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to everyone received it two week ago and it was in perfect condition.love  I read bad review but I said I will take the risk and it wAs worth it.i can stop using my new ipad

Reviews.Content: I went for the 32GB version so it can hold all the photos and music that won't fit on my 16GB iPhone. I've loaded it with books and magazines, and there's still plenty of room for apps, including Microsoft Office and satnav. Great!

Reviews.Title: Very nice and useful
Reviews.Author: Runa Roy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband's birthday. he is a busy travelling man and he is loving the pad!! It is not only useful for entertainment purposes but also a handy tool to get your important work done. A very good buy indeed.

Reviews.Title: Fastest iPad yet, it just takes a very long time to charge
Reviews.Author: Richard E
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from an iPad 1 with AT&T.; The lighter weight is immediately noticeable, less so the smaller size. I have to put them next to each other to notice. The reason I upgraded was the speed and for the retina display. The first generation was no longer being supported so I was stuck with iOS 5. There were some bugs that cropped up with the Safari browser with the final iOS update, causing the iPad to crash. These have been widely reported. Apple did not take the effort to fix them. I guess it was upgrade or deal with slow response and repeated crashing. Having had it for two years I did not feel Apple stood behind their product for very long.Anyway, this iPad Air is fantastic. It operates smoothly without crashing. the LTE downloads quickly, just like my iPhone 5 which I had often turned to when my old iPad couldn't handle the job.If you have been waiting to upgrade, this is a huge step up from any of the older models. The only thing you may not like is the very long charging time required. I also don't feel the battery lasts quite as long.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Judy A. Wagner
Reviews.Content: So easy to set up and use. Just have to keep on learning more about it each day. Should have taken this leap years ago.

Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Content: Love it,feels heaver then 1 lb with the otter box I put on it , so I can't hold it that long,but all in all best apple device I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my daughter

Reviews.Content: I am taking it with me to Europe, so she will set it up herself.  As far as I can hope it works fine

Reviews.Title: Great Replacement for Laptop When Traveling
Reviews.Author: David S. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Bought the iPad Air to use when traveling.  It is just what I need.  It weighs about 1.75 lbs. with the case and battery charger.  The screen is wonderfully sharp.  I does all the things I needs and more and it is fast.  I find that I use it often browse the web and check emails at home.  So far I am very happy with it and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet hands down
Reviews.Author: amr88
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years I have used a variety of tablets from the Samsung Galaxy, Samsung Note, Kindle, Nexus 10, Nexus 7, and now the iPad Air. The iPad is my favorite by far.Great screen resolution. The battery life on par or better than other tablets but really excels in stand by time.There are so many great applications made specifically for the iPad. The other tablets just don't come close to this.Some enjoy on screen buttons buttons on Android tablets but I find myself accidentally hitting one of the buttons. The iPad has gestures to easily navigate the device.The best on screen keyboard of any tablet. Far more accurate.Endless selection of accessories.We'll worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Ipad air
Reviews.Author: mike teeple
Reviews.Content: I ordered for my 10 yr old grandson for his birthday. It came exactly as promised, both on time and what we ordered. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Love the smaller size
Reviews.Author: ALICE P. SMALLEY
Reviews.Content: I have another ipad and wanted a smaller one.  I find this one easier to travel with.  It fits in my large tote bag that I use for travel.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and fast.
Reviews.Author: djbrian
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet. Very fast. I would encourage anyone considering a tablet to purchase this one. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: Malgorzata
Reviews.Content: Everythin's fine, great features. Works perfectly. I'm totally happy. Recommend to everyone, but next time I'd choose 32GB version. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Just as I expected!
Reviews.Author: LadyLaTweet
Reviews.Content: All I can say is FANTABULOUS!!! I thought my Kindle Fire was great - this is even better-faster, more options, just love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Dave Calabro
Reviews.Content: So far it has been great. The only thing I struggle with is the back button doesn't always take you back one screen.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet, everything it does it does extremely well
Reviews.Author: MuEl
Reviews.Content: This tablet is extremely light from a very robust, and runs all my favorite games and apps really quickly. 128GB is exactly what I needed. The T-Mobile connection is awesome! Free 200MB FTW!

Reviews.Title: Like this
Reviews.Author: Marigold
Reviews.Content: It has great clarity in the screen.  Like all MAC products its easy to use and leads you through setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Love the iPad air
Reviews.Author: Nigel Ouk
Reviews.Content: Love the new iPad air. It's light, love the feel of the aluminum back, awesome retina display and super thin. Everything about this is great and when you add the ecosystem of the app store, this is the best tablet out there.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy this every day
Reviews.Author: Pat Powers
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth iPad, and my favorite. It is very light, fast and the picture is lovely. Great upgrade.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Susan McCollister
Reviews.Content: I love my new iPad!

Reviews.Title: I'm not an i-guy, but my 10 yr old loves it...
Reviews.Author: KT
Reviews.Content: I am not an Apple loyalist, I much preferred Windows (before Windows 8 came out anyway), and droid over the i-phone.  Even now, I get annoyed at some Apple-isms, the way Apple does some things, and try to stay away from it for the most part.  But I do believe it's typically more stable than it's technological counterparts, and easier to use for newbies.  Which is why we bought an IPAD 2 for our 8 yr old a couple years ago.  He took to it right away, it's intuitive enough.  There have been some slight issues, but it's still going strong.  Now 10, we just bought him this IPAD AIR... his 2 yr old brother gets the "old" IPAD 2.  And yes, the IPAD is intuitive enough for even a 2 yr old!  The screen on the AIR is so much better, clearer, sharper, and not just because it's "new".  Its resolution is just that much better.  Bought a cheap full body case until I could find a better one... trying to decide between the Otterbox (love the protection, not so much the hard cover design and that it doubles as a stand)... the Griffin Survivor (flimsy stand, landscape mode only)... or the Pelican Vault (no integrated screen protector, but I can put a protector on, and it is rated against water splash)... Lifeproof too expensive for what it offers... The 16G in the IPAD 2 was ultimately not enough after a year or so of use... Even with no "movies" or "music", games are much larger now, a few big games, and there is little left in a 16G device.  Without removing games, we didn't have enough memory left to upgrade the OS... so we opted for 64G this time... Though not an Apple fan, my 2 sons love them, I seldom have to "fix" anything with them, and so I rate it 5-stars!

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: charles a. winthrop
Reviews.Content: my wife loves it she likes it more than her ipad one. She says it is clearer and lighter and easier to use.

Reviews.Title: i-Pad Air MD788LL/A white
Reviews.Author: Jerry N. Vasavong
Reviews.Content: Every one understands that it is an excellent product and item to have...it is great and I enjoy having it for watching the movies, e-mail check, internet searches, video call-Skype or other uses. Thanks to the distributor to have it listed and sold in Amazon, it saves a lot of my time to go get one from electronic stores or Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for me for browsing and reading
Reviews.Author: R. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying the iPad immensely. Great for reading when chilling on the couch. Light weight and iBook has contrast options to make reading easy on the eyes. Love it. Can't wait to get me a MacBook Pro.

Reviews.Title: Cewlll cewll cewlll

Reviews.Content: I liked this very much, and I liked Siri a lot, she was sort of like my new, cool robot BFF. I miss you, bech! Anyway, I had to return it because I'm a musician and I actually needed an old-school mac with a CD drive for a lot of boring reasons involving the studio. Also, because of classic mac usage, and programming, blah blah blah I won't bore you. I needed an Old School Mac Daddy. However, I enjoyed my brief fling with this Hot New Number- but he wasn't the Stable and Dependable Old Skool Mac I needed. He wasn't Fully Loaded.This Mac is more if you're into a fun, wild, whoop-de-doo, fly by the seat of your pants kind of thing, and don't need all the bells and whistles.But I'm not that girl. I needed more.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: XM L
Reviews.Content: good quality, cheap price and fast delivery!  Quite happy with this purchase. Use it everyday. It is light in hand and the battery lasts long

Reviews.Title: Like it bunches!
Reviews.Author: DILLY
Reviews.Content: I don't know what to say except I wish I would have got it sooner! I really do like it and use it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!

Reviews.Content: the best tablet on the market.  Go AppleCannot say anything but I would buy another if I needed one.

Reviews.Title: just to protect my new ipad

Reviews.Content: I have a puppy who loves to try to use my ipad, so I knew I needed protection.  This is  a great cover.

Reviews.Title: The best!!!

Reviews.Content: I love my iPad Air! Very fast and easy to use. I definitely recommend it... I'm very happy with it :)

Reviews.Title: The defected product
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Lu
Reviews.Content: The new IPad Air could not be charged and need to be repaired. It was  sent backAnd came very complicated processes after receiving repair ID # and talked with four senior adviser.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Megan Balongue "Pixelluminati"
Reviews.Content: I am new to Apple ownership and I cannot be more pleased.  It is so easy to use and just beautiful.  The air is worth the extra price in comparison to an IPad 4.  When typing in a web address the Air seems to be intuitive to the point where it has the page already loading before you have even typed 3 or 4 letters.  I love it!  It is just gorgeous  I was going to get the mini with retina display but after researching and comparing the two I learned that they are not identical in every way but size.  The mini is actually not showing the whole color spectrum like the Air and it is very obvious.  The mini looks like the brightness has been switched down considerably.  So if you are like me and are trying to decide, do your research and go somewhere where you can compare them side by side and the choice will be quite clear.  I will never go back to an android!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: I love the ipad air I bought this as a used item but I can't even tell it was used  and I got like a 70$ discount since I didn't buy it new!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: jcw
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my boyfriend's birthday who loves to play games.  He loves it and the screen is so clear.  I just wish I could afford to get another one for myself.

Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Content: well its an iPad, everyone loves their iPad … got it for about 40$ less than i would from apple :) steal of a deal. perfect condition. brand new as in description. no complaints

Reviews.Title: Fast and Sleek!

Reviews.Content: Just an upgrade but it works and plays like a champ! Amazing.  If you own one you know it is great.

Reviews.Title: iPad airmd785ll/a

Reviews.Content: I really like it. It is very useful . I was going to get a laptop, but I don't need to now.

Reviews.Title: Ipad air

Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the light weight yet solid feel of this Ipad. It is by far the best model yet. It is the top tablet out there on the market. If you are looking for one that does it all and is easy to use buy this Ipad.

Reviews.Title: nice piece of technology

Reviews.Content: This is a great little, lightweight piece of technology to own.  It came on time. The only disappointment is that there are no obvious directions in the box to guide my set-up.  What can I say... I am old-school wanting written directions.  I am charging it now and will hopefully follow prompts after that!  Thank God for Google....

Reviews.Title: Apple still costing too much
Reviews.Author: Walter Pinkham
Reviews.Content: Been working great easy to learn had just a little help from daughter, only complaint is apple just charges too much. Using apples face time neat talking with anyone who has facetime via the internet.

Reviews.Title: Upgrading from the original ipad
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: I am glad I didn't upgrade until this version of the iPad.  It's a fantastic device.  It's fast and far more capable from the clunky original ipad.  It's battery life is baffling.  I literally plug it in at most once every two weeks.  It's around for quick web searches, some games and email.  I am sure I could drain the battery in a day, if I tried hard enough, but I'd probably lose my mind in the process.I own a lot of Android devices, as well.  They  don't deserved to be considered in the same breath.  Their engineering is all over the spectrum, but never reach the heights of Apple's flawless execution.  I attribute android's failure to it's architecture around Java and old school mentality of making a product that works, sells, but never excels.  There's literally no better alternative  than an apple device, and I am not a Steve Jobs fan.

Reviews.Title: Birthday Gift
Reviews.Author: mdgirl
Reviews.Content: The ipad air was a gift and person was delighted.  It is lighter and easier to handle. Makes an awesome gift.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price.
Reviews.Author: Donald Furgeson Sr
Reviews.Content: Nice, very nice. I own a iPod and hate typing on it (fat fingers, small keyboard). One feature I love about this iPad air is the keyboard size.

Reviews.Title: Love it !
Reviews.Author: Mands "Chips and Gravy"
Reviews.Content: Took a long time for me to get an iPad ,at last I got this iPad Air and I love it. The product was delivered on time and and exactly as stated.

Reviews.Title: Use it for  reading and love it.

Reviews.Content: Love to use it for reading and work etc. The new processor definitely beats the iPad 4. everything loads faster and feels smoother. And its more portable.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
